item.name: Courtesan's Pack
entries: Includes:

items: an assortment of makeup creams and powders
two bottles each of personal lubricant and massage oil

item.name: Aphrodisiac
entries: Created with fiveleaves, a single bottle of this potent mixture contains 5 doses which can be ingested orally or applied to body directly.

Regardless of how it was absorbed, a dose of aphrodisiac puts you into a heightened state of arousal and increases the body's sensitivity for 1 hour. Consuming multiple doses at once increases this duration by 1 hour per dose and intensifies its effects to the point of unbearable arousal, reduced inhibitions, and an inability to think straight.

item.name: Ball Gag
entries: A ball gag is a small, soft, and flexible ball that fits in the mouth. It is designed to be inserted into the mouth and held in place by the teeth, preventing the wearer from speaking or making noise. The ball is usually made of a soft material, such as silicone or latex, and is designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Bull Whip
entries: A bull whip is a whip with a handle and a long, flexible lash. It is designed to be used for various purposes, such as whipping, flogging, and caning. The lash of the whip is usually made of a soft material, such as leather or synthetic fibers, and is designed to be flexible and durable.

item.name: Chastity Belt
entries: A chastity belt is a device that is worn around the waist and is designed to prevent the wearer from having sex. It is usually made of a soft material, such as leather or synthetic fibers, and is designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Clamp
entries: A clamp is a device that is used to hold an object in place. It is usually made of a soft material, such as leather or synthetic fibers, and is designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Condom
entries: A condom is a thin, latex or polyurethane membrane that is designed to be worn on the penis during sexual intercourse. It is designed to prevent the transmission of sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and pregnancy.

item.name: Dildo
entries: A dildo is a sex toy that is designed to be inserted into the vagina or anus during sexual intercourse. It is usually made of a soft material, such as silicone or latex, and is designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Leather Collar
entries: A leather collar is a collar that is made of a soft material, such as leather or synthetic fibers, and is designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Paddle
entries: A paddle is a flat, wooden or plastic board that is used to spank or paddle the wearer. It is usually made of a soft material, such as leather or synthetic fibers, and is designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Plug
entries: A plug is a small, soft, and flexible ball that fits in the vagina or anus during sexual intercourse. It is designed to be inserted into the vagina or anus and held in place by the muscles, preventing the wearer from having sex.

item.name: Rubber Beads
entries: Rubber beads are a type of sex toy that are designed to be inserted into the vagina or anus during sexual intercourse. They are usually made of a soft material, such as silicone or latex, and are designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Lingerie
entries: Stylish, alluring undergarments made from valuable silk and lace.

item.name: Servant's Clothes
entries: A set of Servant's Clothes modified to prioritize "form" over function. Added frills draw the attention of onlookers and the reduction in fabrics around certain areas suggests that these clothes were made for a different kind of service.

item.name: Dancer's Silks
entries: Dancer's silks are a type of clothing that is designed to be worn during sexual intercourse. It is usually made of a soft material, such as silk or satin, and is designed to be comfortable and easy to wear.

item.name: Bunny's Delight
entries: An amusingly seductive outfit which includes fake rabbit ears and a plug tipped with a white-fluff tail.

item.name: Revealing Robes
entries: Utterly impractical robes that loosely resemble those traditionally worn by mages. Though, whereas most robes conceal the body, these seem solely concerned with flaunting as much of their wearer's body as possible.

item.name: Succubus Crest
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo takes the form of a heart just above the genitals.

Over the course of 1 minute, this needle can be pressed to the skin, turning into ink which becomes the tattoo. The creature holding the needle can choose the color it takes and add simple symbols or a name to the heart-shaped tattoo. This tattoo lasts until you spend 1 minute removing it, at which point it reverts to a needle.
The tattoo gives off a magical glow, which shows through clothing and subjects you to the effects of a dose of aphrodisiac until removed.

item.name: Bra of Holding
entries: While wearing this magical bra, up to 10 pounds of tiny objects can be stored within it by slipping them beneath the bra itself or stuffing them down your cleavage, where they vanish into an extradimensional space. Retrieving an item from this bra requires an action.
If the bra is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bra is removed, its contents spill out.

item.name: Chestwraps of Binding
entries: A simple length of white cloth which can be wrapped around the chest. While wearing these wrappings, you can speak their command word, causing your breasts to become flat.
Removing these wrappings or speaking their command word again immediately returns them to their original size.

item.name: Portal Panties
entries: A pair of provocative panties that are magically linked to two pocket portals (included with purchase) labeled with a 'V' and an 'A' respectively. Whenever you wear these panties, your name is inscribed onto one or both of the pocket portals until you remove them; a creature touching one of the pocket portals can speak its command word, linking it to your body.
Upon speaking the command word again, the link is immediately severed.

item.name: Periapt of Proof Against Pregnancy
entries: This engraved gem appears to be a jewel of small value. While wearing it, it is impossible for you to impregnate or become pregnant.

item.name: Gauntlets
entries: These gauntlets deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage. If you are not wielding any other weapons or a shield, the damage increases to 2d4 bludgeoning damage.
Monks are proficient with gauntlets and they count as monk weapons. However, attacks made with gauntlets do not count as unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dullahan reach maturity at 30 years of age and live well beyond four centuries.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dullahans range from just under 5 to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of where you fall in that range, your size is medium.

entries.name: Headless
entries: You can detatch or reattach your head to your body at will, rendering you immune to decapitation. While your head is detatched, harmless flames spout from your neck, shedding dim light within a 5-foot radius. While headless:

items: You are always aware of the distance and direction from your body to your head as long as they are on the same plane.
While seperated, your headless body cannot utilize any senses that require your head, but can still eat, drink, and cast spells requiring verbal components as long as your head can speak.

If not being carried, your detatched head can be targeted, has an AC of 10 and automatically fails Dexterity saving throws; if your head and body are both caught in the same area of effect, you are only affected by it once.
While detatched, your head can tell when someone is soon to die by natural causes with just a glance and can feel the presence of those nearing their death within a mile it.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Death Coach
entries: As an action, you can call a fey spirit from your shadow that takes the form of a misty, black warhorse, appearing in a space adjacent to you. This horse faithfully serves you as a mount in and out of combat, but cannot take any actions other than dash, disengage, or dodge. As a bonus action, you can call this horse back into your shadow, immediately causing it to dissipate into a black mist. If reduced to 0 hit points, the horse vanishes back into your shadow and cannot be called out again until you have completed a long rest.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kitsune range from just under 5 to 6 feet tall. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kitsune reach adulthood at the age of 100, when they gain the ability to grow additional tails. Kitsune can live for upwards of 1000 years based on the number of tails obtained throughout the course of their life.

entries.name: Fox's Cunning
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception|phb} skill.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Trickster
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion|phb} cantrip; you additionally gain the ability to cast the {@spell Disguise Self|phb} spell with this trait, and at 3rd level, you gain the ability to cast the {@spell Mirror Image|phb} spell with this trait. you regain the ability to cast each of these spells when you finish a long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma.

entries.name: Kitsunebi
entries: You know the {@spell Dancing Lights|phb} cantrip; when you cast the cantrip with this trait, the lights take the appearance of blue flames.

entries.name: Tails
entries: Kitsune are born with a single, large fox tail which serves as their connection to their youkai ancestors. You gain an additional tail at the 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 13th, 15th, and 17th levels.

entries.name: Size
entries: Succubi range from 4 to 7 feet tall. Your size is either Small or Medium.

entries.name: Age
entries: Succubi reach adulthood at 19, marked by the full development of their tails. Their lifespan can extend for thousands of years, with their longevity directly tied to how frequently they feed. In theory, an unchecked Succubus could achieve immortality.

entries.name: Speed.
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet. You also have a flying speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Red Handed
entries: You have two creature types: Fiend and Humanoid. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Half-Truth
entries: When you make a Deception or Persuasion check and roll lower than a 9, you can treat the roll as a 9. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

entries.name: Mischief
entries: You gain a set of wings, which give you a flying speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you can’t be wearing heavy armor.
Additionally, when you are hit with Radiant damage, you cannot regain hit points until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Perfect Body
entries: You can adjust the proportions of your person at will, such as making your breasts larger, or your hips wider. This does not require an action.

entries.name: Racial Feats
entries: The following feats are available to you as a Half-Succubus: {@feat Forked Tongue|FoA}, {@feat Siren’s Snare|FoA}, and {@feat Stalk and Seduce|FoA}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although Oni typically reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, their maturation will rapidly slow beyond that, leading to them as an extremely long lived race; often reaching up to and exceeding 750 years of age should they survive long enough.

entries.name: Size
entries: The average Oni ranges from just under 6 feet tall to bordering the fringes of 8 feet in height. They are most seen with well maintained physiques and solid frames. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: As an indication of their more predatory nature - Oni are readily capable hunters in twilight forests and night plains. You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Imperial Will
entries: Once per long rest, when you fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can reroll the d20 and add your proficiency bonus to the new roll if you don’t already add it. If you do so, you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Pride of Horn and Claw
entries: You have sharp, durable claws at the ends of your fingertips and nearly indestructible horns. You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d4 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Additionally, you gain advantage on Athletics checks when using your horns to ram objects or break down doors.

entries.name: Sub-Types
entries: Four major Sub-Types of Oni exist within this world. That being the Dai-Oni, Ma-Oni, Taku-Oni and Ryo-Oni. Choose one of these subraces.

entries.name: Brutish Build
entries: You count as one size larger for determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift - as well as for the purposes of initiating and maintaining a grapple, as well as moving a grappled creature.

entries.name: Thickly Muscled
entries: You have densely woven muscle fibres, affording you incredible durability only enhanced by the adrenaline felt from wading into battle unarmored. When you aren’t wearing armor or a shield, your base AC is 13 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Magical Prodigy
entries: You learn one 1st level Evocation, Conjuration, or Transmutation spell of your choice from the {@filter Wizard|spells|class=Wizard}, {@filter Warlock|spells|class=Warlock}, or {@filter Sorcerer|spells|class=Sorcerer} spell list and can cast it using this feature for free once per long rest. You can choose Intelligence or Charisma as your spellcasting ability for this spell when you make your choice.

entries.name: Arcane Blood
entries: You gain resistance to Force damage.

entries.name: Dependable Presence
entries: When an ally within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you fails a saving throw, misses an attack roll, or fails an ability check - you can use a reaction to incite a spur of encouragement. They can choose to re-roll the d20 and potentially turn it into a success.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your Proficiency Bonus rounded up, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Thoughtful Practice
entries: You have always made it a point to keep an active and focused mind in learning and honing your skills. When you finish a long rest, choose one skill that you have proficiency in to become practiced in. Whenever you make an ability check with the chosen skill, roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the check’s total.

entries.name: Beyond your Limits
entries: When faced with the greatest of adversity, you are willing to bring yourself to the very brink to survive.

Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can expend up to a number of remaining hit dice equal to your proficiency bonus and roll them normally to be dropped to the resulting HP total instead. One minute after using this feature, or when you perceive your surroundings as safe, your HP is reduced to 0.
If you fall to 0 HP again before the effect ends - you immediately start with one failed death saving throw.

entries.name: Keen Intuition
entries: Walking the line between the mistrusted Oni and the accepted races of the land has given you better insight into how others perceive you. You make {@skill Insight|phb} checks with advantage when determining if a creature is lying to you or harboring ill intent towards you.

entries.name: Age
entries: Though most lone Merfolk tend to die fairly young, the average Merfolk can live upwards of 200 years when maintaining a healthy lifestyle.

entries.name: Size
entries: Merfolk vary greatly in size, but roughly fall into a range of five to eight feet from head to tailtip. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: While supposed covens of evil Merfolk do exist, the vast majority of their race tend towards good alignments.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: You can breathe air and water, but you need to be submerged at least once every 8 hours to avoid suffocating. Additionally, you have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Water-Speaker
entries: Aquatic animals have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast that has a swimming speed. It can understand your words, though you have no special ability to understand it in return.

entries.name: Lakeborn Lore
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill History|phb} and {@skill Nature|phb}.

entries.name: Merfolk Mysteries
entries: You learn the {@spell Shape Water|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell Create or Destroy Water|phb} with this trait.

Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Wall of Water|xge} spell with this trait. Once you cast Create or Destroy Water or Wall of Water with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Hearty Specimens
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Riverborn Talents
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Athletics|phb} and {@skill Perception|phb}.

entries.name: Upstream Swimming
entries: As a bonus action, you can make a running long jump directly towards an enemy without needing to move first. This jump does not expend any of your movement, and you may choose to use your Dexterity Score instead of your Strength Score when determining the maximum distance you may jump.

The first enemy you hit with a melee weapon attack after landing takes an additional amount of damage equal to your proficiency bonus. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Mudskip Practices
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Medicine|phb} and {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Amphibious Adaptations
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 30ft, and your base swimming speed is reduced to 20ft. Additionally, you lose the Limited Amphibiousness trait. You gain a burrowing speed of 5ft.

entries.name: Expel Stores
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with the ability to violently spew some of your internally-stored siltwater at a creature within 30ft of you. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} cold damage, and must subtract {@dice 1d6} from the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn.

On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}). You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Deep Sea Secrets
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Arcana|phb} and {@skill Stealth|phb}.

entries.name: Tentacled Fiends
entries: Your adaptation to the deep sea has changed you to become a far better predator than most. Choose one of the following features, which you gain:

items: Segments of your body gain an otherworldly glow, lighting up at your command. At will, you can cause yourself to emit bright light in a 10ft radius and dim light for 10ft beyond that. Additionally, starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell Faerie Fire|phb} and {@spell Enthrall|phb} with this trait. Once you cast Faerie Fire or Enthrall with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

In lieu of a tail, your waist splits into a number of tentacled appendages- Eight total. The tentacles can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property. Each one is also a natural weapon, which you can use to make an unarmed strike with. If you hit, they do {@dice 1d4} + your strength modifier bludgeoning damage. Immediately after hitting, you can try to grapple the target as a bonus action. Your walk and swim speeds are reduced by 5ft for each tentacle holding an item, or for each creature you are grappling. Additionally, if you use a tentacle to perform any of the listed actions here, your speed is reduced by 5ft until the end of your turn.
